Issues.Title: Enable default HttpClient handler
Issues.Body:
This uses the feature implemented by @kjpou1 https://github.com/mono/mono/pull/10152. It means you can now do `new HttpClient()` directly and it works under Blazor on WebAssembly.

Note that we still register a `HttpClient` in the default DI config, because that instance has its `BaseUri` populated, meaning that it knows how to make requests with relative URLs. If you do `new HttpClient()` then you can only make requests to absolute URLs. This is standard for .NET's `HttpClient`.

Additionally, this involved updating to a newer version of mono (bfc35fc6e65). Benchmarks show that this newer version of Mono is consistently 10-20% faster on our checked scenarios (app startup, rendering, JSON handling), but it's also about 150KB bigger after linking.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Enable default HttpClient handler" (#1372)

Issues.Title: Mono IL Linker Error with MVC Scaffolding
Issues.Body:
Having added MVC scaffolding to my Blazor project Mono is unable to resolve the System.Resources.Reader assembly.
```
Fatal error in IL Linker
Mono.Cecil.AssemblyResolutionException: Failed to resolve assembly: 'C:\Usrs\Jamie\.nuget\packages\system.resources.reader\4.3.0\lib\netstandard1.0\System.Resources.Reader.dll, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null' ---> Mono.Cecil.AssemblyResolutionException: Failed to resolve assembly: 'C:\Usrs\Jamie\.nuget\packages\system.resources.reader\4.3.0\lib\netstandard1.0\System.Resources.Reader.dll, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null'
   at Mono.Linker.DirectoryAssemblyResolver.Resolve(AssemblyNameReference name, ReaderParameters parameters)
   at Mono.Linker.AssemblyResolver.Resolve(AssemblyNameReference name, ReaderParameters parameters)
   at Mono.Linker.LinkContext.Resolve(IMetadataScope scope)
   at Mono.Linker.LinkContext.Resolve(IMetadataScope scope)
   at Mono.Linker.LinkContext.Resolve(String name)
   at Mono.Linker.Steps.ResolveFromAssemblyStep.Process()
   at Mono.Linker.Steps.BaseStep.Process(LinkContext context)
   at Mono.Linker.Pipeline.Process(LinkContext context)
   at Mono.Linker.Driver.Run(ILogger customLogger)
   at Mono.Linker.Driver.Execute(String[] args, ILogger customLogger)
```

Have confirmed the DLL is present and the linker is finding it (I get a different error if it's not there).


I'm not entirely sure how I got here so it's hard to reproduce. I added MVC scaffolding, resolved the errors the import brought and was able to run the project, but having added controllers and models this error is thrown every build.

The usual cleaning the project/deleting the bin and obj folders hasn't helped. Backtracking and removing the controller and model files I added also hasn't helped.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Mono IL Linker Error with MVC Scaffolding" (#1380)

Issues.Title: Sending objects with only private setters should give a warning
Issues.Body:
When sending objects in Blazor with private setters on their properties, those properties are always empty at the client, and no warnings are given.

This is a limitation of the MessagePack de/serialization, [issue here](https://github.com/neuecc/MessagePack-CSharp/issues/284). Private fields are never serialized.

It would be very helpful to show a warning from JsInterop. It could save hours of head-scratching. At least if ALL properties have private setters - which indicates the developer doesn't know of this limitation. 

There is a very helpful warning from the jsinterop project when you're trying to send an object with a non-public constructor. So it might be possible to add another warning at this location.

Source:
```
var constructorDelegate = ConstructorCache[type] ?? 
throw new InvalidOperationException($"Cannot deserialize JSON into type '{type.FullName}' because it does not have a public parameterless constructor.");

```
[Link to source](https://github.com/dotnet/jsinterop/blob/a9a5bb9eba154d9dc3f43d5636e49d02cbd6cc97/src/Microsoft.JSInterop/Json/SimpleJson/SimpleJson.cs#L1473)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Sending objects with only private setters should give a warning" (#1376)

Issues.Title: Issue with Javascript Interop in Server Side Blazor Project
Issues.Body:
Currently I am trying to access the play() method on an HTML audio tag.

`<audio id="timeOverPlayer" preload="auto"><source src="@settings["Time Over Sound"]" /></audio>`

I've got a Script tag in my index.html file:

`    <script>
        window.playElement = function (element) {
            document.getElementById(element).play();
            return true;
        }
    </script>`

And I'm trying to call this function from C# with the following static method which is an event handler (if that's important):

```
    public void OnFiveMinuteWarning(object sender, EventArgs args)
    {
        PlayAudio("fiveMinutePlayer");
    }
```

```
    public static Task<bool> PlayAudio(String elementName)
    {
        return JSRuntime.Current.InvokeAsync<bool>("playElement", elementName);
    }
```

When this happens I get no audio and no errors in the console. I can manually call the Javascript from the console, and the audio plays fine. If I add a Wait() on the PlayAudio method call, I get an error:

> System.AggregateException
  HResult=0x80131500
  Message=One or more errors occurred.
  Source=System.Private.CoreLib
  StackTrace:
   at System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Wait(Int32 millisecondsTimeout, CancellationToken cancellationToken)
   at System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Wait()
   at WebClock.App.Pages.Clocks.OnTimeOver(Object sender, EventArgs args) in C:\Users\samue\source\repos\BlazorClock\WebClock\WebClock.App\Pages\Clocks.cshtml:line 52
   at WebClock.App.Services.Clock._timer_Elapsed(Object sender, ElapsedEventArgs e) in C:\Users\samue\source\repos\BlazorClock\WebClock\WebClock.App\Services\ClockService.cs:line 111
   at System.Timers.Timer.MyTimerCallback(Object state)

> Inner Exception 1:
> JSException: Could not find 'playElement' in 'window'.
> Error: Could not find 'playElement' in 'window'.
>     at http://localhost:37382/_framework/blazor.server.js:23:47556
>     at Array.forEach (<anonymous>)
>     at p (http://localhost:37382/_framework/blazor.server.js:23:47517)
>     at http://localhost:37382/_framework/blazor.server.js:23:48120
>     at new Promise (<anonymous>)
>     at e.beginInvokeJSFromDotNet (http://localhost:37382/_framework/blazor.server.js:23:48094)
>     at http://localhost:37382/_framework/blazor.server.js:16:11652
>     at Array.forEach (<anonymous>)
>     at e.invokeClientMethod (http://localhost:37382/_framework/blazor.server.js:16:11623)
>     at e.processIncomingData (http://localhost:37382/_framework/blazor.server.js:16:10229)
> 

Not sure if this is just not being raised when async or if the error is because I'm Waiting on an async call. At this point I'm pretty puzzled.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Issue with Javascript Interop in Server Side Blazor Project" (#1381)

Issues.Title: How to pass more ChildContents from razor file?
Issues.Body:
Hello, I'm playing with ChildContent on a component and can't find solution for following: Let's have reusable base component allowing to include three parts. **SplitterBase.cshtml** ```
@Part1
@Part2
@Part3
@functions { [Parameter] RenderFragment Part1 { get; set; } [Parameter] RenderFragment Part2 { get; set; } [Parameter] RenderFragment Part3 { get; set; } //just one ChildContent property is not enough in this case } ```How is it possible to pass the parts from parent component defined in cshtml? **Splitter.cshtml** ``` How to define Part1 here? How to define Part2 here? How to define Part3 here? ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "How to pass more ChildContents from razor file?" (#1378)

Issues.Title: Add support for Razor templates
Issues.Body:
Adds support for Razor templates and `RenderFragment`. Razor templates are a little-known Razor feature that looks like: ``` @.... ``` It's so little known that it's not even covered in our docs, but it's been around for many many years. This features hasn't been implemented until now for Blazor, and this feature brings it back as a build building block for templated components (more to come). In Blazor land a template like: ``` @{ RenderFragment template = @
@item.Name
; } ``` complies to code like: ``` RenderFragment template = (__builder, item) => { __builder.OpenElement(...); ... __builder.CloseElement(...); } ``` Since the declaration always has a generic type parameter inside, it needs to be in a context where the type is known.. ie: not with `var`. See tests for ways to consume templates. NOTE: There are the following caveats for templates - Templates require a single root element. - Templates don't work in the `@functions { }` block These limitations are baked into the core of Razor and will take a while for us to address (v3.0).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Add support for Razor templates" (#1360)

Issues.Title: Parameter of type object and string literal
Issues.Body:
Hi there.
I tried to create a parameter of type object and than use type switch for various types (a single message of type string or a list of messages).
So I have created a parameter:

```C#
[Parameter]
protected object Message { get; set; }
```

Then, when I use it with literal value:

```html
<Alert Message="Try adding some exchange rates." />
```

It strips out `"` and generates an invalid code:

```C#
builder2.OpenComponent<Money.UI.Blazor.Components.Bootstrap.Alert>(63);
builder2.AddAttribute(64, "Message", Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.Components.RuntimeHelpers.TypeCheck<System.Object>(Try adding some exchange rates.));
builder2.CloseComponent();
```

It seems that only string is buggy, boolean and int values work.
Also when I pass a value of some property, it's ok.

I'm using Blazor 0.5.1.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Parameter of type object and string literal" (#1377)

Issues.Title: Sending json without refreshing the page
Issues.Body:
**Issue**
There's no a natively way (without ajax) to send a POST request without refreshing the whole application.

**Context**
Imagine that you have a form in one of your pages, and you need to submit that form without refreshing any element. Using Http.SendJsonAsync doesn't work for this purpose because it refreshes the entire application, not even the current page.

If there's a way please tell me, I researched in all the few Blazor tutorials that currently exists and I found nothing.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Sending json without refreshing the page" (#1356)

Issues.Title: Router support for Multiple Libraries
Issues.Body:
The Blazor.Routing.Router can be extended with multi Assembly routing but you have set many methods private and also internal classes, this does not allow you to extend the Router and RouteTable but you need to rewrite them.
For example it could extend RouteTable with Append method (like Create) for add route entries for others libraries (Assembly), finally can change the parameter AppAssembly in array (AppAssemblies) for append all entries in Router.SetParameters() for multiple libraries.
Another good idea could be to activate the use of url prefixes related to the namespaces of each library (maybe through a parameter in the Router) to avoid conflicts between any components / pages with the same name in the various libraries.

Could I contribute to the project by applying these changes, is it possible?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Router support for Multiple Libraries" (#1358)

Issues.Title: HttpClient interception
Issues.Body:
Hey guys,

first of all, thank you for the awesome work you do with Blazor.

What is or what would be the recommended way to reconfigure the HttpClient in the DI? Are Delegating Handlers supported at all?

I need support for the following use cases:
 - Send CSRF token with each POST/PUT/â€¦ request like Angular does. (or are there any other way to achieve protection any other way?)
 - Intercept all responses and redirect the currently logged-in user to login, when session expires and the backend API returns 401.
 - Retry for particular error codes.

Thank you.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "HttpClient interception" (#1362)

Issues.Title: Shareable string constant as route template
Issues.Body:
Blazor project (ASP.NET Core hosted) (client project) v 0.5.1.

I wanted to create shareable route templates.
```
static class UiPaths
{
    public static string Account = "account";
}
```
---
### Solution 1 - reference string constant in page:
-	Put `@page UiPaths.Account` to Account.cshtml.

Issue 1
-	Compiler complains error: The 'page' directive expects a string surrounded by double quotes.
---

### Solution 2 - create code behind class:
```
	[Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.Components.RouteAttribute(UiPaths.Account)]
	public abstract class AccountPageCodeBehind : Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.Components.BlazorComponent
	{
	}

```

	Remove all @page directives from Account.cshtml.
	Put "@inherits AccountPageCodeBehind" to Account.cshtml.
Issue 2
	The application throws exception in runtime:
	Error: System.InvalidOperationException: Failed to compare two elements in the array. ---> System.InvalidOperationException: The following routes are ambiguous:
		'account' in 'BlazorInNetFW.Client.Pages.Account'
		'account' in 'BlazorInNetFW.Client.Pages.AccountPageCodeBehind'

The problem is ComponentResolver is static class instead of replaceable service and it finds code behind class as a regular component. Then RouteTable creates RouteEntry even for the code behind class.

---
If I understand correctly, only possible solution here is to create and use custom router (instead of Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.Routing.Router). However, I think it would be better if it's possible to maintain route paths/templates in configurable way (possibly even paths taken from a DB) instead of custom Router. Could you provide your opinion and outline code changes (if any), please?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Shareable string constant as route template" (#1363)

1. Have setup Two projects. First is API, second is Client Blazor app which is referenced by API.
2. I do build of solution using dotnet build
3. then I run `dotnet publish API --no-build`

Resulting the generated output does not contains .blazor.config
when I run `dotnet publish` without specifying `--no-build` produced package contains valid `blazor.config` file. This make whole published package unusable.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Could not publish with --no-build" (#1370)

Issues.Title: Button's onclick triggered upon right mouse click
Issues.Body:
When you have onclick event e.g.
```
<button onclick="@HandleClick">Click me</button>
```
it's triggered upon both left and right button click. I think it's a bug, as you can read in living HTML [standard](https://w3c.github.io/uievents/#event-type-click):
>The click event type MUST be dispatched on the topmost event target indicated by the pointer, when the user presses down and releases the **primary** pointer button, or otherwise activates the pointer in a manner that simulates such an action.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Button's onclick triggered upon right mouse click" (#1369)

Issues.Title: Framework location path should be configurable
Issues.Body: I am experimenting with different hosting scenarios for a Blzaor App and thought about packaging it into a Chrome Extension / App. however, Chrome Extension do not support _ at the begining of a path because it is reserved for system use.  Blazor make extensive use of _ in the path, at least for _framework and _bin. These paths should be configurable so that scenarios like Chrome Extension can be supported / tested.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Framework location path should be configurable" (#1353)
